Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.controller

Class BoardSceneController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.controller.BoardSceneController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class BoardSceneController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class handles the controls for the scene with the Board and all the game phases.

The BoardSceneController is loaded from the BoardScene.fxml file. In the CENTER of the Scene there is the actual Board. All the game phases are handled from this class and can be divided into three different phases. When the Scene loads, the player will either be waiting for the other players to go through their first phase or be themselves in the first phase.

  • First phase: in this phase the player is choosing its first workers positions and has a actionCode = 1 value. The method that handles the click on a cell of the GridPane, onCellClicked(MouseEvent), automatically adds a Worker to the board and sends to the Client all needed information. When this phase ends the player has to either wait for the other players to go through their first phase or second phase.
  • Second phase: in this phase the game has actually started and each player plays its turn. It has a actionCode = 2 value. When its the player's turn the method that handles the click on a cell, onCellClicked(MouseEvent), shows the player, with a visual clue, which cell is selected and all possible actions that they can make. Buttons are disabled, or not, depending on the possible actions.
  • Third phase: a player has won and the game has ended. The notification of either winning or losing is shown through an Image, the GridPane with the board is cleared and all buttons are not visible.

All phases and possible actions are displayed as notifications in the bottom right of the screen.

    • actionsCodes

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> actionsCodes
      A List for possible game Phases.

      When actionCode = 1 the game is in the initial phase where the player is choosing the position of its workers

      When actionCode = 2 its the player's turn

      When actionCode = 0 the game just started

      public static javafx.scene.text.Text notification

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Sets the BoardScene and handles the buttons' events.

      The Board Scene starts with all buttons disabled and the domeButton and declineButton as not visible. ActionCode is set to 0. The player godPower is retrieved from the MainStage.

      MoveButton Event

      When the moveButton is clicked, the information of the new Position and the ID of the worker that was moved is sent to the Client. Then all buttons and indicators are disabled and reset.

      BuildButton Event

      When the buildButton is clicked, the information of the Position of the new building, the ID of the worker and if the building is a Dome is sent to the Client. Then all buttons and indicators are disabled and reset.

      domeButton Event

      When the domeButton is clicked, the information of the Position of the new building, the ID of the worker and the fact that the building is a Dome is sent to the Client. Then all buttons and indicators are disabled and reset.

      declineButton Event

      When the declineButton is clicked, the information that the turn ended is sent to the Client. Then all buttons and indicators are disabled and reset, together with the workers' information.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -
      See Also:
      resetAllPossibleIndicators()

      position - the Position corresponding to the StackPane
      See Also:
      addWorkerImage(StackPane, int)

    • onCellClicked

      public void onCellClicked​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the click event on a cell of the board.

      The method behaves differently based on the actionCode.

      When ActionCode = 1

      The game is in the initial phase where the player needs to choose its workers first Position. When the player clicks on the board they position a worker immediately on the board. A check for possible already positioned workers is made.

      When ActionCode = 2

      It's the player's turn. To help the player better visualize what cell of the board they have clicked on, an Image will appear on the selected StackPane. Firstly the player needs to select the worker they want to make an action with. The worker selected is saved and a notification of which worker has been selected is shown. When a worker is selected the Player will be notified of the types of action they can make. When the player clicks on a Cell with a possible action the Button of the respective action will be visible and the player will be able to click it.

      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent
      See Also:
      displayWorker(StackPane, Position), addSelectedImageToCell(StackPane, int, ImageView)

    • updateWorker

      public void updateWorker​(Position newPosition, Position oldPosition, int playerID)
      Updates the Position of the worker image on the board. It removes the Image of the worker from its old Position and adds the new one in the new Position. The color of the worker is decided based on the playerID
      Parameters:
      newPosition - the new Position where to put the image
      oldPosition - the old Position where to delete the image
      playerID - the player number that we need for the color of the worker
      See Also:
      addWorkerImage(StackPane, int)

    • removeWorker

      public void removeWorker​(Position workerPosition)
      Removes the worker Image from the Board.
      Parameters:
      workerPosition - the old Position where to delete the Image.

    • updateWorkerInitialPosition

      public void updateWorkerInitialPosition​(Position newPosition, int playerID)
      Adds the Image of the worker at the start of the game. This method is exclusively used in the ActionCode=1 phase, when the Player has chosen its workers initial Position.
      Parameters:
      newPosition - the new Position where to put the image
      playerID - the player number that we need for the color of the worker
      See Also:
      addWorkerImage(StackPane, int)

    • updateBuilding

      public void updateBuilding​(Position newPosition, boolean dome)
      Updates the Image of the buildings.
      Parameters:
      newPosition - Position on the board where to put the image
      dome - true if the building that needs to be added is a dome, false otherwise.
      See Also:

    • addWorkerImage

      public void addWorkerImage​(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane cell, int playerID)
      Adds the worker Image to a StackPane.

      The color of the worker is blue for playerID = 1, yellow for playerID = 2, green for PlayerID = 3.

      Parameters:
      cell - the StackPane where to add the Image.
      playerID - the player number that we need for the color of the worker

    • addBuildingImage

      public void addBuildingImage​(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane cell, java.lang.String level)
      Adds the building image in a StackPane.

      The String level is used to find the right image for the building. If the building is a dome the image is a ImageView, otherwise it's the Background of the StackPane.

      Parameters:
      cell - the StackPane where to add the building
      level - the building level

    • addZToPosition

      public Position addZToPosition​(int x, int y, java.util.Set<Position> set)
      Adds the Z coordinate to a Position.

      The position that is saved when a player clicks on the board lacks the z coordinate. The method checks, from the available moves/build List, the Position with the same x and y coordinate to get z coordinate.

      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      set - the Set where to check for the z coordinate
      Returns:
      the Position object with all the coordinates

      Parameters:

      code - if the Image needs to be removed(DELETE) or added(ADD)
      selectedImage - the ImageView to add to the StackPane

      public void displayEndGameImage​(boolean isVictory)

      Parameters:
